contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2012}} {{Use British English|date=August 2012}} {{Infobox London station |symbol = dlr | name = Tower Gateway | image_name=Tower Gateway DLR stn entrance 2009.JPG | manager = [[Docklands Light Railway]] | fare_zone = 1 | access = yes | access_note = <ref>{{Citation step free tube map}}</ref> | locale = [[Tower Hill]] | borough = [[City of London]] | events1 =Opened | years1=31 August 1987 | platforms= 2 | interchange = [[Fenchurch Street railway station|Fenchurch Street]] | interchange1 = [[Tower Hill tube station|Tower Hill]] | interchange_note = <ref>{{citation London station interchange May 2010}}</ref> | latitude = 51.5104 | longitude = -0.0746 | map_type = Central London | label_position = left | original = [[Docklands Light Railway]] | dlrbat0708 = 3.523 | dlrbat0809 = 1.308 | dlrbat1011 = 3.993 }} '''Tower Gateway''' is a [[Docklands Light Railway]] station near the [[Tower of London]]. It is in [[Travelcard Zone 1]]. It adjoins the tracks to [[Fenchurch Street railway station|Fenchurch Street]] and is on the site of [[Minories railway station]]. It is a short walk from Tower Hill and Fenchurch Street stations. Access at street level from the [[Minories]] is via escalator, stairs or lift at the western end of the station. A pedestrian crossing connects the station with [[Tower Hill tube station]], its closest London Underground connection. A narrow secondary staircase entrance at the eastern end of the platform, improved considerably in the early 2000s, descends to [[Mansell Street]]. It serves the eastern edge of the [[City of London]] financial district and development around [[St Katharine Docks]]. It was opened in 1987 as the western terminus of the initial DLR system and the station closest to central London. The underground extension to [[Bank station (London)|Bank]], which opened in 1991, diverges from the original route between Tower Gateway and [[Shadwell DLR station|Shadwell]], the next station to the east. It dives down a steep ramp not far from the eastern end of the platforms, from which it is clearly visible. Tower Gateway is the terminus for the less busy service to [[Beckton DLR station|Beckton]]. Journeys to other branches of the DLR normally require a change. In keeping with the DLR's original basic lightweight philosophy, Tower Gateway is a simple elevated terminus. As built it had two tracks and a cross-over. When the extension to Bank opened, its importance was substantially reduced. Before reconstruction it had a fairly narrow central platform, and a single track leading from the main route to a set of points immediately prior to the platforms. Further major alterations began on 30 June 2008. The station reopened on 2 March 2009, rebuilt as a single-track terminus to enable three-car trains with a platform on each side of the train, one for arriving passengers and the other for departures (the [[Spanish solution]]). <gallery> Image:Entrance to Tower Gateway station, Docklands Light Railway - geograph.org.uk - 668858.jpg|The entrance to the station in 1988.
